results.justification: The document explicitly states the research methodology, focusing on experimental studies investigating the effects of explanations on algorithm aversion. (e.g., 'In this paper, we provide a background on algorithm aversion in education and present two experimental studies…')

Both Study 1 and Study 2 have detailed descriptions of their design, participants, procedure, manipulation, and measures. (e.g., '3.1 Participants', '3.2 Procedure', '4.1 Participants', '4.2 Experimental Manipulation')

The document states, 'All code, data, and supplementary materials for this study are available on OSF at https://osf.io/cjadu.' and 'Materials on OSF https://osf.io/7c5zt/?view_only=58f0a6314e9243e9acdbd1c844d43d7b'.
No justification is provided for not sharing data, as the data *is* shared.
The document describes the variables and measures used in the study. (e.g., '3.4 Measures', '4.4 Measures')

Data collection methods are fully described, including recruitment through Prolific and the use of online surveys. (e.g., '3.1 Participants', '3.2 Procedure', '4.1 Participants', '4.2 Experimental Manipulation')
The document states, 'All code, data, and supplementary materials for this study are available on OSF at https://osf.io/cjadu.'
No justification is provided for not sharing code, as the code *is* shared.

The document states that all code is available on OSF, implying code for data preparation is included. ('All code, data, and supplementary materials for this study are available on OSF at https://osf.io/cjadu.')
Statistical tests (linear regression) and models are clearly described. (e.g., 'We examined how algorithm preference varies across experimental conditions by fitting a linear regression model.')
Effect sizes (e.g., 0.25), p-values (e.g., p = 0.7209), and regression coefficients are reported. (e.g., '𝐹3,164 = 0.4454,𝑝 = 0.7209', '𝑏 = 0.466,𝑡164 = 2.583,𝑝 = 0.011')
The document includes a thematic analysis of the open-ended responses from participants, providing subjective context and interpretation. (e.g., '4.5.2 Exploratory Measures')
The data coding and analysis process for the qualitative data (notes to parents) is described, including the identification of themes. (e.g., 'We extracted two types of themes…')
Results are clearly presented in text and figures (e.g., Figure 2, Table 1, Table 2).
Limitations are discussed, including the use of Prolific participants and the context of the study being limited to ITS. (e.g., 'First, the data collected was from educators on Prolific…')
The document contains a link to the preregistration on OSF: 'The study was preregistered on OSF at https://osf.io/cjadu.'
